treatment.reference: Nitrate and Phosphate Affect Cultivability of Cyanobacteria from Environments with Low Nutrient Levels (Ernst, A., et al., 2005)
treatment.description: small red-pigmented phycoerythrin (PE)-rich cyanobacteria, dominate the autotrophic picoplankton in freshwater ecosystems, These non-bloom-forming Synechococcus spp. (19) belong to the same phylogenetic clade as marine Synechococcus spp. and Prochlorococcus spp., can tolerate high nitrate if phosphate is low
